title: Digital Wellbeing-Informed Online Language Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Digital Tool Utilization Skills and Intermediate Language Proficiency
context.additional_context: A blended course combining real-time video classes and asynchronous learning activities

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five principles of the Digital Wellbeing Framework (DW-FOLD)—intentional technology use, cognitive load management, physical activity integration, social connectivity enhancement, and self-reflection promotion—to online language classes.
Learners can prevent digital fatigue and work-life imbalance by establishing a learning plan within 15 hours per week.
Learners can reduce cognitive overload by 30% by applying 25-minute focus + 5-minute break (Pomodoro Technique) when using digital tools during language learning.

resources: Collaborative Tools for Language Learning (Google Docs/Padlet)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
